Text: Cracon du Nez (Montana):  The Cracon du Nez ridge is an example of Missouri River stream bank erosion developing toward a future "stream capture" of the Teton River flow.

Text: Cracon du Nez (Montana):  A trail runs along the top of the ridge, where in 1865 Little Dog, a chief of the Piegan Blackfoot tribe was ambushed and killed by rebellious and jealous warriors from his own Piegan band.

Triplets:<Cracon du Nez

5:
--------------------
Text: Cracon du Nez (Montana):  The name is derived from the French and means bridge of the nose, and was probably given by the French boatmen who comprised keelboat crews in the fur trade in the upper Missouri River in Montana during the early decades of the 1800s.
Triplets:<Cracon du Nez
